result.execSummary:
All charges against Amy Marie Conner in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amy Marie Conner is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Payable to A.C., chk # 033231. Mailed 7/11/22.  gll
Payable to Defendant, chk # 033233. Mailed 7/11/22.  gll

02:45 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker, DE: Amy Marie Conner pro se. State moves to dismiss without prejudice. State will continue to investigate and will be given a citation for OWI - 1st. Court dismisses case. Adjourned: 2:48 PM. kma
Felony Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 6/21/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km
22R 008416   Posted by self at Clerk of Court window.  gll
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

of Absconder Status. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km 
Per SJN, set STC for next week re testing compliance. kap/km
from DE requesting to test in Eau Claire. Per SJN- Denied. JA copied ltr back to DE w/Judge's response. gll

DE called to state she did not have a copy of her bond and didn't know where to check in. Clerk provided JSC phone #. DE said they wouldn't be able to check in Hudson and said they could stop by Eau Claire. Clerk advised bond stated St. Croix JSC and DE would have to contact them, and could write a letter asking for the bond to be modified. srb
DE left voicemail stating she didn't receive a copy of her bond when she was released from jail. Clerk left voicemail for DE providing phone number for JSC and mailed copy of bond to DE 6/10/22.  gll

Settlement conference on August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant to post additional $200 to be paid within 2 weeks from today.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and comply with all licensing restrictions.

01:27 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker and Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius and Kaitlin Dippolito, DF:  Amy Marie Conner appeared from jail. INCLUDES 22CF372 and 22TR1675 (IN). DE qualifies for public defender.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. State requests bond. Ms. Dippolito makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Ms. Dippolito waives time limits on preliminary hearing. Court sets SETC and PSC. 22TR1675: NG plea entered. Adjourned: 1:36 PM. kma  Settlement conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
